source.author: Barker, W.R.
source.title: Scrophulariaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Barker, W.R. (1999). Scrophulariaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Annual herb, with a single main stem, and branching in consecutive nodes
Perennial herb, with after first year more than one main stem, and branching in sporadic nodes
Corolla white to lilac, with yellow blotch sometimes on lower side of mouth
Corolla lilac, lacking purple striations. Leaves pinnatifid, the apical lobe 2–15 mm long
Corolla white to lilac, with purple longitudinal striations on the lobes. Leaves crenate-serrate, the apical lobe 2–6.5 mm long
Calyx and bracts without prominent eglandular hairy margin, the outer surface glabrous or glandular-hairy
Calyx and bracts densely lined by soft long white eglandular hairs, the outer surface lacking glandular hairs
Corolla white to lilac with prominent purple longitudinal striations on the lobes; anther backs glabrous or hairy
Corolla white to lilac, not prominently lined; anther backs hairy
Leaves with 1–2 pairs of teeth; anther backs glabrous
Leaves with 1–7 pairs of teeth; anther backs hairy
